question: How do I perform Burpee
context: If you want to know 'How do I perform Burpee', the answer is 'Start standing with your feet hip-width apart. Lower your body into a squat position, placing your hands on the ground in front of you. Quickly jump your feet back into a plank position, keeping your body in a straight line from your head to your toes. Perform a push-up, keeping your core tight and your elbows close to your body. Jump your feet back towards your hands, and then jump up into the air, reaching your arms overhead. Land softly and immediately lower your body back into the squat position to repeat the movement.'.

question: How do I perform Band Internally Rotated Chest Fly
context: If you want to know 'How do I perform Band Internally Rotated Chest Fly', the answer is 'Start with both feet hip-width apart and step on the middle of the band with both feet. Hold the handles of the band in each hand and position the band above your chest, with your palms facing down. Hold the position for a few seconds and then slowly lower your arms back to the starting position, keeping the internal rotation of your shoulder joints throughout the movement.'.

question: How do I perform Barbell Squat
context: If you want to know 'How do I perform Barbell Squat', the answer is 'Stand with your feet shoulder-width apart. Maintain the natural arch in your back, squeezing your shoulder blades and raising your chest. Grip the bar across your shoulders and support it on your upper back. Unwrack the bar by straightening your legs, and take a step back. Bend your knees as you lower the weight without altering the form of your back until your hips are below your knees. Raise the bar back to starting position, lift with your legs and exhale at the top.'.

This will put your lower back in a rounded position, which is very dangerous.) Raise the weight back to starting position.'.

question: How do I perform Barbell Bulgarian Split Squat
context: The answer to the question 'How do I perform Barbell Bulgarian Split Squat' is 'Find a box or bench that is roughly knee height or a few inches lower. (The lower the box is the lower the mobility requirement). You can either place your toes or the top of your foot on the box. Point your front foot forward or slightly turned outwards and break at the knees and hips simultaneously. Aim to get your front leg to hit parallel depth (hamstring parallel with the ground) or lower. The further forward your front foot is, the longer the Range of Motion is at your hips. The further back your front foot is, the longer the ROM at your knees.'.

context: The answer to the question 'How do I perform Dumbbell Bulgarian Split Squat' is 'Find a box or bench that is roughly knee height or a few inches lower. Point your front foot forward or slightly turned outwards and break at the knees and hips simultaneously. Aim to get your front leg to hit parallel depth (hamstring parallel with the ground) or lower. The further forward your front foot is, the longer the Range of Motion is at your hips. The further back your front foot is, the longer the ROM at your knees.'.

context: If you want to know 'How do I perform Dumbbell Overhead Squat', the answer is 'Stand with your feet slightly wider than shoulder-width apart and hold two dumbbells overhead with both hands, using an overhand grip. Begin the squat by bending at the hips and knees, keeping your core tight and the dumbbells balanced overhead. Lower your body as far as you can while keeping the dumbbells overhead, then push back up to the starting position. Repeat for the desired number of repetitions, making sure to keep your back straight, chest lifted, and the dumbbells stable overhead throughout the entire movement.'.
answer: Stand with your feet slightly wider than shoulder-width apart and hold two dumbbells overhead with both hands, using an overhand grip. Begin the squat by bending at the hips and knees, keeping your core tight and the dumbbells balanced overhead. Lower your body as far as you can while keeping the dumbbells overhead, then push back up to the starting position. Repeat for the desired number of repetitions, making sure to keep your back straight, chest lifted, and the dumbbells stable overhead throughout the entire movement.

Go down as far as you can while still maintaining control, then exhale and return to standing position, keeping the dumbbell overhead. Repeat for desired reps and then switch to the other arm.'.

Push through your right foot to return to the starting position and repeat the movement with the other leg.'.

question: How do I perform Burpee
context: If you want to know 'How do I perform Burpee', the answer is 'Start standing with your feet hip-width apart. Lower your body into a squat position, placing your hands on the ground in front of you. Quickly jump your feet back into a plank position, keeping your body in a straight line from your head to your toes. Perform a push-up, keeping your core tight and your elbows close to your body. Jump your feet back towards your hands, and then jump up into the air, reaching your arms overhead. Land softly and immediately lower your body back into the squat position to repeat the movement.'.

Jump your feet back towards your hands, and then jump up into the air, reaching your arms overhead. Land softly and immediately lower your body back into the squat position to repeat the movement.

context: The answer to the question 'How do I perform Dumbbell Thruster' is 'Start by standing with your feet shoulder-width apart and holding a dumbbell in each hand. Slowly lower the dumbbells back down to the starting position, and repeat for the desired number of repetitions.'.

question: How do I perform Plate Overhead Carry
context: If you want to know 'How do I perform Plate Overhead Carry', the answer is 'Start by standing upright with your feet shoulder-width apart. Hold a single weight plate overhead with both hands, keeping your arms extended straight above your head. Begin walking forward, taking slow and steady steps while maintaining a straight line. Your focus should be on maintaining balance and control of the weight plate overhead. As you walk, continue to keep your arms extended and the weight plate overhead. Try to maintain good posture and avoid leaning forward or backward, as this could result in losing control of the weight plate. context: 'Begin in a comfortable seated position on your mat, with your legs crossed and your spine straight. Extend your right arm up toward the ceiling and bend it at the elbow, bringing your right hand behind your head. Reach your left arm behind your back and bend it at the elbow, bringing your left hand up between your shoulder blades. Clasp your hands behind your back, trying to touch your fingertips together. If you can't quite reach, you can use a strap or towel to bridge the gap between your hands.' is the answer to 'How do I perform Two Arms Cow Face Pose'.
answer: Begin in a comfortable seated position on your mat, with your legs crossed and your spine straight. Extend your right arm up toward the ceiling and bend it at the elbow, bringing your right hand behind your head. Reach your left arm behind your back and bend it at the elbow, bringing your left hand up between your shoulder blades. Clasp your hands behind your back, trying to touch your fingertips together. If you can't quite reach, you can use a strap or towel to bridge the gap between your hands.

context: The answer to the question 'How do I perform Barbell Squat' is 'Stand with your feet shoulder-width apart. Raise the bar back to starting position, lift with your legs and exhale at the top.'.

question: How do I perform Barbell Bulgarian Split Squat
context: The answer to the question 'How do I perform Barbell Bulgarian Split Squat' is 'Find a box or bench that is roughly knee height or a few inches lower. (The lower the box is the lower the mobility requirement). You can either place your toes or the top of your foot on the box. Point your front foot forward or slightly turned outwards and break at the knees and hips simultaneously. Aim to get your front leg to hit parallel depth (hamstring parallel with the ground) or lower. The further forward your front foot is, the longer the Range of Motion is at your hips. The further back your front foot is, the longer the ROM at your knees.'.

context: 'Take a shoulder width, double overhand or mixed grip. Push your hips back while leaving your knees mostly extended. Look for a stretch in your hamstrings. answer: Take a shoulder width, double overhand or mixed grip. Push your hips back while leaving your knees mostly extended. Look for a stretch in your hamstrings. When you feel the stretch, push your hips forward until you're back in a standing position.

label: Exercises
question: How do I perform Dumbbell Bulgarian Split Squat
context: The answer to the question 'How do I perform Dumbbell Bulgarian Split Squat' is 'Find a box or bench that is roughly knee height or a few inches lower. (The lower the box is the lower the mobility requirement). You can either place your toes or the top of your foot on the box. Point your front foot forward or slightly turned outwards and break at the knees and hips simultaneously. Aim to get your front leg to hit parallel depth (hamstring parallel with the ground) or lower. The further forward your front foot is, the longer the Range of Motion is at your hips. The further back your front foot is, the longer the ROM at your knees.'.
answer: Find a box or bench that is roughly knee height or a few inches lower. (The lower the box is the lower the mobility requirement). You can either place your toes or the top of your foot on the box. Point your front foot forward or slightly turned outwards and break at the knees and hips simultaneously. Aim to get your front leg to hit parallel depth (hamstring parallel with the ground) or lower. The further forward your front foot is, the longer the Range of Motion is at your hips. The further back your front foot is, the longer the ROM at your knees.

question: How do I perform Barbell Coan Deadlift
context: When asked 'How do I perform Barbell Coan Deadlift', the response is 'Stand with your feet hip-width apart and place a barbell on the floor in front of you. Bend at the hips and knees to grasp the barbell with an overhand grip, positioning your hands just outside of your hips. Keeping your back straight and your core engaged, lift the barbell off the floor by extending your hips and knees. As you lift the barbell, pull your shoulders back and squeeze your glutes to fully extend your hips at the top of the movement.'.
